final_answer:
The image uses humor and satire to highlight the irony in consumer culture and modern work life. The T-shirt features a quote from "Fight Club": "We work jobs we hate, to buy sh*t we don't need." This statement criticizes the cycle of working in unsatisfying jobs to purchase unnecessary items. 

The irony is highlighted by the stick figure wearing this T-shirt while standing in an office, the type of environment often associated with mundane and dissatisfying jobs. The humor comes from the contradiction between the anti-consumerism message and the setting, implying the figure is part of the very cycle criticized by the T-shirt. The words "YES, BUT" further emphasize the contrast between the ideal and the reality.
